title: Harry Styles and flashes his chest tattoos as he poses with Kate Moss' ex Jefferson Hack in London
text:
He's not afraid to show off his impressive body art and eccentric style.

But Harry Styles went for a more classic look with an edgy twist when he attended The Store X The Vinyl Factory's Transformer exhibition in London on Friday.

The singer, 25, flashed his bird chest tattoos at the event as he slung a friendly arm over Kate Moss' ex Jefferson Hack, who curated the show.

Looking sharp: Harry Styles, 25, flashed his chest tattoos as he posed with Jefferson Hack, 48, at The Store X The Vinyl Factory's Transformer exhibition in London on Friday

Harry opted for a fitted black suit with a striped white t-shirt which sat low, flashing his toned chest and ink.

The Dunkirk actor also donned a pair of maroon shoes with a gold buckle on the front for the event on The Strand, to brighten up his ensemble.

Jefferson, 48, who is the father of supermodel Kate Moss' only child Lila-Grace, 17, looked relaxed as he posed for pictures with Harry.

The co-founder of Dazed Media wore a patterned t-shirt under a grey denim jacket at the art event as well as black trousers and well-polished shoes.

Cool dudes: Both Harry and Jefferson opted to wear black at the art event and looked relaxed as they posed for a photograph

Smart pair: Jefferson curated the exhibition and slung a friendly arm around the Dunkirk actor

Friday's night's event is part of Frieze London, and features newly commissioned and debut works by artists including Doug Aitken, Juliana Huxtable and Evan Ifekoya.

Exhibition Transformer explores ideas of identity, representation and self-image, while questioning how coming together to take action can help shape change.

Last weekend Harry was seen partying until 4am at exclusive The Araki Restaurant in Mayfair with two friends.

He left the glitzy establishment, where seats are a minimum of £350 per person, at 11pm and headed to the Chiltern Firehouse in Marylebone, before sneaking out a back door at 4am.

Style: Harry is not afraid of making bold fashion statements and wore a blue velvet suit for his Rock and Roll Hall of Fame Induction Ceremony in March with a low cut white t-shirt

Fashion: The singer and actor turned heads in his black ruffled, see-through ensemble at the Met Gala in May this year

The heavily-inked singer teased at his toned chest in a low-cut orange sweater with the sleeves rolled up around his wrists.

Harry has recently been putting the finishing touches to his second solo album which, he told Rolling Stone's September issue, is 'all about having sex and feeling sad.'

He also revealed to the publication that he had a little psychedelic help while working on his new songs.

He described how, at the studio in Malibu: 'We’d do mushrooms, lie down on the grass, and listen to Paul McCartney’s Ram in the sunshine.'

Styles went on: 'I was standing when we were doing mushrooms and I bit off the tip of my tongue.

'So I was trying to sing with all this blood gushing out of my mouth. Mushrooms and Blood. Now there’s an album title!'

Success: Since going solo, Harry has raked in millions from his own music with an eponymous chart-topping debut album in 2017, which had the biggest sales week for a UK male since 1991 (pictured with his former One Direction bandmates in 2013)

Since going solo, Harry has raked in millions from his own success. An eponymous chart-topping debut album in 2017 had the biggest sales week for a UK male since 1991, The Evening Standard reported.

Harry's figures for his first touring run last year saw 89 sell out crowds, almost a million tickets sold and a £960,000 donation to charity.

His first stadium sold out within 29 seconds, according to Variety.
description: Harry Styles, 25, showed off his two bird tattoos on his chest in a low cut t-shirt and open blazer at an exhibition, which was curated by Jefferson Hack, 48, in London on Friday.
